content.description: Farthest-left route on the wall that pulls the roof in the most vertical section.  Starts with techy edging on the slab and then a whopper of a roof pull crux.
content.protection: bolts with a fixed-draw anchor.  The chain used was too thin to get a locker in, so we just TR'd through the fixed draws, so maybe bring a quicklink or a thin-spined locker.

content.description: Fun climbing up the cracked face, involving some sidepulls and stems.
content.location: At the left side of the Prospector Wall, just right of Honeypepper.

content.description: Climb the  blocky arete with a bit of wandering left and right.
content.location: Right side of main Nugget Wall ledge.

content.description: A fabulous climb on the left side of the Nugget Wall.  The first 30 feet is amazing face climbing, which is technical with great movements. There's a good rest before moving into the groove at the top.
content.location: Veer left near the top of the approach to the Prospector Wall.  Honeypepper lies on the far left of the Nugget Wall, and is the second to last route to the east.

content.description: Clip the first bolt of Bank Shot and continue up and right to a left-slanting seam. Shares anchor with Bank Shot. There is also an extension of unknown grade.
content.location: Left side of main Nugget Wall ledge.

content.description:
This route runs to the right of the cube on some fun handholds, then stays to the right again on the arete above, making a fun 5.7 move onto the face of the arete to the chains (officially the anchor for the route to the left of the cube "Savior Self" 5.9).

WARNING: when you gain the ledge above the cube, be careful not to knock off the many loose rocks.
content.location: Located on the first craig (Nugget Wall) of the Prospector Area. From the main trail walk right a couple hundred yards until you see "The Cube."  Borrowed time starts along the right side of the cube.

content.description: Head up and left from the main ledge. Pull  over a bulge and head up and right from a mono pocket.
content.location: Left side of main Nugget wall ledge.

content.description:
From Mazama Rock by Burdo:

This route was bolted by an unknown party early in the area's development, but was seen as a forlorn, mangy character, due to unclean rock & inconsistent climbing. Burdo refurbished the route in 2007, making it a decent quality route which can be finished at the chains of "Karmic Relief".  It is possible to continue the original line via a bouldery arete (10a/b) to a sling anchor, but this is not currently recommended.
content.protection:
6 bolts.

Chains just to the right on the 10a route next to it. As Burdo states, it's not worth it to continue the original route up the arete -- the webbing on the sling anchor is worn & not confidence inspiring (causing this climber to downclimb to chains).
content.location: From the Lost River Rd walk the main trail on a couple switchbacks to the first set of craigs on Prospector Wall.  Scramble up the loose scree to the slightly better belaying area.  Fifth route from the left (excluding the 5.6 on the lower short wall).
